text: Bray Island is one of the Canadian Arctic islands located in Nunavut, Canada along the southern coast of Baffin Island. It is located in Foxe Basin, at 69°16'N 77°00'W, and has an area of . Bray Island was the home of FOX-A, a Distant Early Warning Line and now a North Warning System site. ==References== Category:Islands of Foxe Basin Category:Islands of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago Category:Uninhabited islands of Qikiqtaaluk Region Category:Former populated places in Arctic Canada Category:Former populated places in the Qikiqtaaluk Region
title: Bray Island
